results.title: Baton Rouge
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Mahot, Humbert Balsan and Rachid Bouchareb
results.brief_description:
Baton Rouge’ is the story of three friends, one Frenchman, Mozart, and two Beurs (see footnote), Karim and Abdenour, who dream of travelling to Baton Rouge in pursuit of the American Dream (inspired by a Mick Jagger song). After a series of sequences set in the suburbs of Paris, introducing the characters, and showing them doing various temporary jobs, a whimsical twist of fate allows the threesome to make their dream come true. The plot follows their adventures in the United States as they journey south to Louisiana. Although they encounter obstacles aplenty, and are forced by lack of money into bumming train rides or stealing from a garage, they also bathe in the warmth of a more tolerant atmosphere than they have come to expect in France.” Reference: “Questions of identity in Beur cinema: from ‘Tea in the Harem’ to ‘Cheb’”. Screen 34:4 (Winter 1993): pp 321-342. Footnote: The word Beur is derived from Parisian backslang for ‘arabe’ (Arab), and was in circulation within the immigrant community in the late 1970s. Its hybrid form reflects the conflict of identity experienced by the newly visible ‘second generation’ (as they are still called).

Credits: Producers, Humbert Balsan, Jean-Pierre Mahot ; director, Rachid Bouchareb ; writers, Rachid Bouchareb, Jean-Pierre Ronssin ; photography, Jimmy Glasberg, Pierre Dupouey ; music, John D. Faure.
Cast: Jacques Penot, Pierre-Loup Rajot, Hammou Graia, Elaine Foster, Romain Bouteille, Katia Tchenko.

results.title: Batman returns
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Tim Burton and Denise Di Novi
results.brief_description: Tim Burton continues to give this popular comic book hero his own fractured spin in this moody, atmospheric sequel to “Batman” (1989), primarily drawing influence from the darkness of the original comic conceptualised by Bob Kane in the 1939. This time, the angst-ridden Batman (Michael Keaton) must save Gotham City from plunging into chaos after the sociopathic Penguin (Danny De Vito) surfaces to reclaim his birthright, then plots and schemes a path to mayorhood, aided by the evil industrialist Max Schreck (Christopher Walken). Shreck inadvertently creates another problem for the caped crusader after his browbeaten secretary Selena Kyle (Michelle Pfeiffer) mysteriously metamorphoses into Catwoman after a bad day at the office. Batman suddenly finds he has his hands full trying to expose the corrupt workings of the Penguin’s rise to prominence while fighting his attraction to the felonious feline whom is determined to kill him. Set amidst a world of fairground freaks and the surreal, noirish space of Gotham City, this film explores the duality of human nature and the fine line that separates the heroes from the villains.

results.title: Batman forever
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Tim Burton, Peter MacGregor Scott and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: The third film in the Batman series, based on the comic book character created by Bob Kane introduces Batman’s sidekick Robin. Gotham City millionnaire Bruce Wayne (Val Kilmer) a renowned playboy who’s charms attract the attention of psychologist Dr Chase Meridian (Nicole Kidman). Bruce trys to hide his alternate persona as Batman from her, as well as from his new ward acrobat Dick Grayson (Chris O’Donnell). This proves to be difficult when Two-Face (Tommy Lee Jones) and The Riddler (Jim Carrey) and their henchman try to brainwash the people of Gotham City.

results.title: Batman's village
results.creator_credit: Ivor P. Kershaw and Factual Films of Australia
results.brief_description: A picturesque view of Melbourne city interspersed with factual information on its history and the key figures involved in its establishment. Inner city streets, buildings and botanical gardens are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivor P. Kershaw and Factual Films of Australia

results.title: Batman
results.creator_credit: Guber-Peters Company, Warner Bros Pictures, Jon Peters, Peter Guber and Tim Burton
results.brief_description: Based on the comic book character created by Bob Kane, this “Batman” reflects the darkness of the original syndication and in no way resembles the 1960’s successful television series of the same name. Michael Keaton is Batman and Jack Nicholson portrays “The Joker”, his arch enemy. The sets are dark, gigantic and forbidding and the finale is set amongst a cathedral backdrop reminiscent of the set of “The Hunchback of Notre Dame”.

results.title: Batik
results.brief_description: A history of the Indian and Indonesian art and a demonstration by Nancy Belfer. Shows modern and traditional pieces being made. We see washing, drying and framing the cloth, the initial blocking-in of shapes, working with heated wax, the tjanting tool and the tjap, with a sequence on the actual printing and dyeing of the cloth. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Bathtime
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, John Bird, David Atkinson and Peter Madden
results.brief_description: A humourous claymation where a woman after waking in the morning takes a bath going through her morning cleansing ritual before work. The partner only later wakes up to find the woman missing.

results.title: Bathing the patient (home care)
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Ted Nemeth Studios, United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids and Marian Evans
results.brief_description: A guide to the home care of that maimed and injured loved one, recently returned from that dust-up in the Pacific. Solemn tone betrays not the least sympathy for the invalided one. In the absence of emotion, the domestic environment becomes a place of chilling austerity. Dutiful wife seeming resigned to her fate as resentful attendant. Frightening for its utilitarian ommissions. United States Office of Education training film for use in the instruction of professional nurses.

results.title: Bathing the bed patient
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Procedure for making a bed with a minimum of disturbance to the patient. Also demonstrates the proper method of washing the patient with as much comfort as posible.
